page.title: 11Housing in Chalton
page.content: {See Budden's farmhouse under Local {History. One of the houses a group visited had been converted from the old Post Office and shop, with the old bakery at the back made into a grandparents annexe. {The oldest house}we visited, is called Chalton Priory. A very large flint building abutting onto the church. It used to be the rectory owned by the Abbess of Nuneaton. Another house was the old Board School. The new owners have put in a bathroom and inside loos. The old Schoolroom, about 10 metres by 20 metres has been turned into a sitting room. A barn had been converted into a house. One new house was being built.
